_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

Tech Aerofoam Products International, Inc. (TAPI), is relocating its manufacturing operation from the site at State Road PR-3 Km. 12.7 to a new site at Rosendo Vela Street, No. 6 at the Jardines de Carolina Industrial Park in Carolina, Puerto Rico. 

Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies
Tech Aerofoam Products International, Inc. (TAPI), as a responsible member of the community, fully intends to comply with all applicable Federal, State and local regulations that cover its manufacturing operation in Carolina, Puerto Rico.  To do so, TAPI has established effective programs, set standards and implemented procedures that ensure a safe manufacturing operation and the protection of the environment, the employees, the customers and the citizens of the community where TAPI resides. 
Tech Aerofoam Products International, Inc. understands that responsibility for a Safety and Health program is a compromise between company management and the employees.  TAPIÂ¿s policy is, and will always be, to provide a safe and healthy work environment. In order to do this, TAPI provides a safe facility and provides the training that will enable the employees to become better professionals. In turn, TAPI just requires that all employees obey and follow the safety rules in place. 
	Management will be responsible for:
1)	Developing, updating and implementing the operational procedures and practices that will allow the jobs to be executed in a safe manner
2)	Teaching and training the employees on the safety practices to be followed at TAPI and ensuring that employees use the required personal protective equipment.

Employees at TAPI will be responsible for:
1)	Obeying the safety rules
2)	Participating actively in the company safety programs
3)	Notifying management of any unsafe condition in the workplace
4)	Suggesting changes and improvements to the procedures
5)	Helping in motivating coworkers to work safely. 
Tech Aerofoam Products International, Inc

. has communicated and explained to all its employees the health hazards and risks associated with its manufacturing operation and has also communicated and explained to them the policies, procedures, programs and plans that intend to prevent the occurrence of accidents, releases or disruptions and, in case of an emergency, delineate how to respond to reduce injury to human health and environmental damage. 

Regulated substances handled
Tech Aerofoam Products International, Inc. operates a manufacturing facility in Carolina, Puerto Rico in an industrial lot of owned by International Textile Products International, Inc. The facility is composed of manufacturing areas, office space, parking lots, aboveground storage tanks, warehouse space, and truck maintenance and washing area. Operation of this facility began in 2008.
TAPI is a producer of polyurethane foam produced by the reaction of an isocyanate group with an alcohol or hydroxyl contributor (polyol) in the presence of water and catalyst. The reaction is started in a reaction mixer and continued in a container to allow the expansion and blowing off the heat and gases formed and the molding of the foam.
Employees collect the foam blocks and store them for curing in a designated area of the warehouse. Usually, the foam is ready for further cutting and processing in 24 hours. 
TAPI uses a listed chemical that exceeds the threshold quantity established in the RMP regulations (40 CFR 68.130). This chemical is Toluene Diisocyanate (unspecified isomer). 
There are no regulated flammable substances used in the manufacturing process that exceed the threshold quantity.
TAPI has performed and has documented an Offsite Consequence Analysis for the accidental release of TDI, following the EPAÂ¿s Risk Management Program Guidance for Offsite Consequence Analysis document and utilizing the RMP.Comp software for endpoint distance estimation. The report on this analysis is part of this Risk Management Plan documentation.

Accidenta

l Release Prevention Program 
TAPIÂ¿s Release Prevention Program relies on the use of good engineering and management practices, training and a strong preventive maintenance program. The program complies with all applicable federal, state and local regulations for the prevention of accidents or releases of hazardous substances. Some of the actions taken at the facility to prevent accidental release include the following:
Â·	Periodic inspection of storage tanks, lines, pumps, valves, etc.
Â·	Manual inspection of level indicators prior to loading of the tanks to prevent overfilling
Â·	Storage tanks are located inside concrete dikes and sheltered to prevent corrosion.
Â·	Automatic shutoff control systems are installed to safely stop the process in case of electrical power loss or any other abnormal condition.
Tech Aerofoam Products International, Inc. has implemented a training program, with both classroom instruction and on the job training for its employees. Employees participate, on a regular basis, on the training sessions as part of Â¿Programa de Seguridad y Salud OcupacionalÂ¿ of the company. Please refer to the Operating Manual of this program for more details. 
Also, as part of the Â¿ Programa de Seguridad y Salud OcupacionalÂ¿, there is an incident investigation procedure which is carried out, as necessary, to determine the root cause of any accident or unsafe condition to prevent recurrence.

Five year Accident History
There is no 5-year accident history involving Toluene Diisocyanate, as defined by EPA in 40 CFR 68.42, for inclusion in the Risk Management Plan since this is a new facility whereto Tech Aerofoam Products International, Inc. is relocating its operations  in 2008. TAPI had no incidents in its previous site.

Emergency Response Program
Tech Aerofoam Products International, Inc. has prepared a written Emergency Response Plan that is part of the Emergency Response Program implemented at the facility.  The Plan includes all the federal, state and lo

cal regulatory requirements for emergency response planning. This Emergency Response Plan defines the steps to be taken in case of an emergency to in order to reduce hazards and damage to employees, property, neighborhood or environment. The plan names the Emergency Response CoordinatorsÂ¿ addresses and home phone numbers and lists the emergency equipment available at the facility for response. New personnel are trained on the contents of the plan and all personnel are retrained on an annual basis.
 Additionally, all employees handling oils and chemicals are trained, on annual basis, on the contents of a Spill Prevention, Control and Countermeasure Plan, as required in 40CFR112.


TAPI has coordinated and discussed the Emergency Response Plan with the Local Emergency Committee of Carolina (Tel. 787-766-2823) and the local Fire Department. In addition, the Company maintains an open agreement with a qualified emergency response contractor to handle emergencies involving hazardous materials.

Planned changes to improve safety
Tech Aerofoam Products International, Inc. believes that the programs and plans in place at its facilities have been very effective in preventing any accidental release of hazardous substances. TAPI also believes that, in case of a chemical release or another emergency, the procedures developed and implemented by the management of TAPI will reduce to a minimum any harm to its employees, the neighborhood and the environment. Nonetheless, the management and the employees of TAPI continuously keep looking for ideas and suggestions to improve the safety and environmental performance of the company.
